title: Leaf physiognomic walkthrough
text: package contains functions enable quick analysis quantitative leaf physiognomic dataset. provide function Digital Leaf Physiognomy (dilp()), estimates paleoclimate via multiple linear regressions calibrated modern dataset. also provide functions Leaf Margin Analysis (temp_slr()) Leaf Area Analysis (precip_slr()), simple linear regressions estimate mean annual temperature (MAT) mean annual precipitation (MAP) respectively. Lastly, provide function reconstructing fossil leaf mass per area (lma()), functional trait reflects leaf resource economy. vignette, ’ll walk standard workflow complete leaf physiognomic dataset, using included McAbeeExample dataset. ease use, template spreadsheet data collection can found : DiLP Data Collection Template. encounter problems, like request feature, please create issue github page. ’s basically ! Climate estimates associated information can found output generated dilp(), leaf mass per area reconstructions can found output generated lma(). Read breakdown key DiLP LMA components helper functions.
code: # If the dataset is in good shape, this is all you need to do  dilp_results <- dilp(McAbeeExample) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` lma_results <- lma(McAbeeExample)  # This just grabs the key data points from the results data.frame(   Site = c("McAbee H1", "McAbee H2"),   MAT_MLR = dilp_results$results$MAT.MLR,   MAT_SLR = dilp_results$results$MAT.SLR,   MAP_MLR = dilp_results$results$MAP.MLR,   MAP_SLR = dilp_results$results$MAP.SLR,   site_mean_LMA = lma_results$lowe_site_mean_lma$value ) #>        Site  MAT_MLR  MAT_SLR  MAP_MLR  MAP_SLR site_mean_LMA #> 1 McAbee H1 13.54419 11.18065 106.7353 126.7697      73.68178 #> 2 McAbee H2 11.63970  9.36000 133.6330 135.8734      67.58568

title: Leaf physiognomic walkthrough
text: go bit depth, dataset correctly formatted, needs done pass dilp() function, takes following steps produce paleoclimate estimates. First, data processed using dilp_processing() function, cleans raw dataset generates derived physiognomic characters based raw physiognomic data. Next, possible errors outlier measurements identified using dilp_errors() dilp_outliers() functions. Finally, Mean Annual Temperature (MAT) Mean Annual Precipitation (MAP) estimated using multiple simple linear regressions. Default parameters used global regressions provided Peppe et al. (2011). information contained within returned list. generating dilp() results, make sure check whether common errors discovered within dataset. errors McAbeeExample dataset, , table identify specimens original dataset triggered errors. Similarly, check outlier datapoints. aren’t necessarily errors, may worth double checking original measurements. McAbeeExample dataset, three specimens identified outliers tooth count:internal perimeter ratio, three specimens outliers leaf area, four specimens outliers perimeter ratio. case, re-examined found acceptable outliers. Now, let’s take look results. Paleoclimate reconstructions generated unique site found within dataset. Margin, FDR, TC.IP, Ln.leaf.area, Ln.TC.IP, Ln.PR columns simply report site-level values parameters used DiLP regressions. MAT.MLR MAP.MLR columns report temperature precipitation results using parameters. MAT.SLR MAP.SLR columns report temperature precipitation results using simple linear regressions. Positive negative error paleoclimate estimates reported well. Finally, dilp_cca() can called make sure sites fit within physiognomic space encompassed calibration data.  site testing falls outside bounds calibration data, DiLP regressions may able accurately reconstruct paleoclimate site. case, McAbee localities fall within bounds calibration data; thus, use DiLP appropriate .
code: # Elements of DiLP results: print(paste0("dilp_results$", names(dilp_results))) #> [1] "dilp_results$processed_leaf_data"       #> [2] "dilp_results$processed_morphotype_data" #> [3] "dilp_results$processed_site_data"       #> [4] "dilp_results$errors"                    #> [5] "dilp_results$outliers"                  #> [6] "dilp_results$results" dilp_results$errors #>                                                   Check Specimen1 #> 1                             Entire tooth count not NA      none #> 2                        Entire tooth count : IP not NA      none #> 3                         Entire perimeter ratio not NA      none #> 4                                   FDR not between 0-1      none #> 5 External perimeter not larger than internal perimeter      none #> 6                Feret is not larger than minimum Feret      none #> 7                    Perimeter ratio not greater than 1      none dilp_results$outliers #>          Variable     Outlier1     Outlier2     Outlier3    Outlier4 #> 1             fdr         <NA>         <NA>         <NA>        <NA> #> 2           tc_ip  BU-712-1117 BU-712-1169A BU-712-1176A        <NA> #> 3       leaf_area BU-712-2173A BU-712-2105A  BU-712-2124        <NA> #> 4 perimeter_ratio   M-2015-1-1 BU-712-1073A  BU-712-1165 M-2015-1-62 dilp_results$results #>        Site   Margin       FDR    TC.IP Ln.leaf.area  Ln.TC.IP     Ln.PR #> 1 McAbee H1 32.25806 0.6965086 2.562487     6.792833 0.6070757 0.2047427 #> 2 McAbee H2 23.33333 0.7012671 2.651242     7.037892 0.6218561 0.1504205 #>    MAT.MLR params.MAT.MLR.error  MAT.SLR params.MAT.SLR.error  MAP.MLR #> 1 13.54419                    4 11.18065                  4.8 106.7353 #> 2 11.63970                    4  9.36000                  4.8 133.6330 #>   MAP.MLR.error.plus MAP.MLR.error.minus  MAP.SLR MAP.SLR.error.plus #> 1           87.74914            48.15775 126.7697           106.5412 #> 2          109.86219            60.29365 135.8734           114.1923 #>   MAP.SLR.error.minus #> 1            57.88926 #> 2            62.04646 dilp_cca(dilp_results)

what: Leaf Mass per Area Reconstructions in Depth
title: Leaf physiognomic walkthrough
text: Leaf mass per area reconstructions can generated smaller subset leaf physiognomic data needed DiLP paleoclimate estimates. really need leaf area petiole width. standard suite DiLP traits already includes leaf area petiole width, just continue using included McAbeeExample dataset. dilp(), results lma() saved within list. lma_results$species_mean_lma includes reconstructed mean LMA every species-site pair dataset. Upper lower prediction intervals calculated well. Three different metrics site level LMA calculated. royer_site_mean_lma lowe_site_mean_lma use slightly different regressions show average LMA species site. lowe_site_variance_lma shows variance species-mean LMA values site.

what: Paleoclimate Estimates with Simple linear regressions
title: Leaf physiognomic walkthrough
text: Sometimes, may full leaf physiognomic dataset recorded site. case, simple linear regressions can used estimate MAT (temp_slr()) MAP(precip_slr()) long margin state leaf area data, respectively. See documentation either function learn different regressions preloaded functions. case, ’ll use Peppe2018 regression MAT Wilf1998 regression MAP. can also use regressions functions long provide slope, constant, standard error .
code: temp_slr(McAbeeExample, regression = "Peppe2018") #>        site  n    lower      MAT    upper #> 1 McAbee H1 31 7.142065 12.14206 17.14206 #> 2 McAbee H2 30 5.410667 10.41067 15.41067 precip_slr(McAbeeExample, regression = "Wilf1998") #>        site  n    lower       MAP    upper #> 1 McAbee H1 17 27.07551  89.55803 217.9242 #> 2 McAbee H2 13 30.95183 102.37976 249.1237 temp_slr(McAbeeExample, slope = 0.290, constant = 1.320, error = 5) #>        site  n    lower       MAT    upper #> 1 McAbee H1 31 5.674839 10.674839 15.67484 #> 2 McAbee H2 30 3.086667  8.086667 13.08667

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthew J. Butrim. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Alexander J. Lowe. Author. Andrew G. Flynn. Author. Aly Baumgartner. Author. Daniel J. Peppe. Author. Dana L. Royer. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Butrim M, Lowe , Flynn , Baumgartner , Peppe D, Royer D (2024). dilp: Reconstruct Paleoclimate Paleoecology Leaf Physiognomy. R package version 1.0.0, https://mjbutrim.github.io/dilp/, https://github.com/mjbutrim/dilp.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dilp: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy},   author = {Matthew J. Butrim and Alexander J. Lowe and Andrew G. Flynn and Aly Baumgartner and Daniel J. Peppe and Dana L. Royer},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0, https://mjbutrim.github.io/dilp/},   url = {https://github.com/mjbutrim/dilp}, }

what: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy
title: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy
text: goal dilp help analysis quantitative fossil leaf traits. Key functions included : Digital Leaf Physiognomy - dilp() Estimate mean annual temperature mean annual precipitation using multiple linear regressions. Fossil Leaf Mass per Area - lma() Reconstruct leaf mass per area using leaf area petiole width Leaf Margin Analysis - temp_slr() Estimate mean annual temperature using leaf margin analysis Leaf Area Analysis - precip_slr() Estimate mean annual precipitation using leaf area analysis

title: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy
text: can install stable version dilp R session : can install development version dilp GitHub :
code: install.packages("dilp") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mjbutrim/dilp")

title: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy
text: Find basic example running DiLP LMA analysis vignette ease use, template spreadsheet data collection can found : DiLP Data Collection Template encounter problems, like request feature, please create issue

title: McAbee Example Data — McAbeeExample
text: Leaf physiognomic data specimens collected McAbee Fossil Beds British Columbia, Canada (Lowe et al. 2018).

title: McAbee Example Data — McAbeeExample
code: McAbeeExample

title: McAbee Example Data — McAbeeExample
text: data frame 192 rows 18 columns: Site Stratigraphic layer locality Specimen Number Repository number individual specimen Morphotype Morphotype specimen belongs Measurer comments Additional notes specimen measurements Margin Whether margin toothed (0) entire (1) Petiole Width width petiole basalmost point insertion leaf lamina Blade area reconstructed area leaf lamina, including petiole Blade perimeter length perimeter leaf lamina, including petiole Feret diameter circle area leaf lamina, including petiole Minimum Feret longest line can drawn two points perimeter selection perpendicular Feret length.  Approximates blade width. Raw blade area area leaf prepared tooth measurements still teeth. Raw blade perimeter perimeter leaf prepared tooth measurements still teeth. Internal raw blade area area leaf prepared tooth measurements teeth digitally removed. Internal raw blade perimeter perimeter leaf prepared tooth measurements teeth digitally removed. Length cut perimeter total length segments leaf removed leaf blade removing damage preparation leaf. . primary teeth number primary teeth along undamaged perimeter . secondary teeth number secondary teeth along undamaged perimeter

title: McAbee Example Data — McAbeeExample
text: Lowe et al. 2018

title: McAbee Example Data — McAbeeExample
text: Lowe, . J., D. R. Greenwood, C. K. West, J. M. Galloway, M. Sudermann, T. Reichgelt. 2018. Plant community ecology climate upland volcanic landscape Early Eocene Climatic Optimum: McAbee Fossil Beds, British Columbia, Canada. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology 511: 433–448.

what: Generate leaf mass per area results — calc_lma
title: Generate leaf mass per area results — calc_lma
text: calc_lma() typically called internally lma(). provides flexibility use custom regression parameters calculate leaf mass per area (LMA).

title: Generate leaf mass per area results — calc_lma
code: calc_lma(data, params, resolution = "species")

title: Generate leaf mass per area results — calc_lma
text: data Must include "petiole metric" combination columns calculate petiole metric "Blade Area", "Petiole Area", "Petiole Width", "Leaf Area" "Petiole Width".  calculating morphospecies-mean LMA, must include "Site" "Morphotype" columns. calculating species-mean LMA, needs include "Site' column. params list regression parameters. Must contain "stat" (= "mean" = "variance"), "regression_slope", "y_intercept", "unexplained_mean_square", "sample_size_calibration" "mean_log_petiole_metric_calibration", "sum_of_squares_calibration", "critical_value". Pre-loaded sets parameters: "royer_species_mean_ma": stat = "mean", regression_slope = 0.382, y_intercept = 3.070, unexplained_mean_square = 0.032237, sample_size_calibration = 667, mean_log_petiole_metric_calibration = -3.011, sum_of_squares_calibration = 182.1, critical_value = 1.964 "royer_site_mean_ma": stat = "mean", regression_slope = 0.429, y_intercept = 3.214, unexplained_mean_square = 0.005285, sample_size_calibration = 25, mean_log_petiole_metric_calibration = -2.857, sum_of_squares_calibration = 5.331, critical_value = 2.069 "lowe_site_mean_ma": stat = "mean", regression_slope = 0.345, y_intercept = 2.954, unexplained_mean_square = 0.01212861, sample_size_calibration = 70, mean_log_petiole_metric_calibration = -2.902972, sum_of_squares_calibration = 1.154691, critical_value = 1.995469 "lowe_site_variance_ma": stat = "variance", regression_slope = 0.302, y_intercept = 5.028, unexplained_mean_square = 0.1713672, sample_size_calibration = 70, mean_log_petiole_metric_calibration = -5.97104, sum_of_squares_calibration = 5.085184, critical_value = 1.995469 resolution Either "species" "site".  Informs whether function calculate morphospecies-mean LMA values ("species") site-mean/site- variance LMA values ("site").  resolution = "site", data must already form species-mean LMA.

what: dilp: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy — dilp-package
title: dilp: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy — dilp-package
text: Use leaf physiognomic methods reconstruct mean annual temperature (MAT), mean annual precipitation (MAP), leaf dry mass per area (Ma), along useful quantitative leaf traits. Methods package described Lowe et al. (review).

title: dilp: Reconstruct Paleoclimate and Paleoecology with Leaf Physiognomy — dilp-package
text: Maintainer: Matthew J. Butrim mbutrim@uwyo.edu [copyright holder] Authors: Alexander J. Lowe Andrew G. Flynn Aly Baumgartner Daniel J. Peppe Dana L. Royer

title: Generate DiLP results — dilp
text: dilp() processes raw leaf physiognomic data, checks common errors/outliers, returns processed data, keys finding potential errors outliers, paleoclimate reconstructions.

title: Generate DiLP results — dilp
code: dilp(specimen_data, params = "PeppeGlobal", subsite_cols = NULL)

title: Generate DiLP results — dilp
text: specimen_data data frame containing specimen level leaf physiognomic data. See Lowe et al. 2024 information collect data. good reference put together data: McAbeeExample Required columns: site specimen_number morphotype margin feret blade_area raw_blade_perimeter internal_raw_blade_perimeter length_of_cut_perimeter no_primary_teeth no_of_subsidiary_teeth Recommended columns: petiole_width petiole_area blade_perimeter minimum_feret raw_blade_area internal_raw_blade_area params Either string referring one two preloaded parameter sets list custom parameters (format list ). Preloaded parameter sets "global" "northern_hemisphere" calibrated based global northern hemisphere data respectively. Allen et al. (2020) illustrates situation northern hemisphere parameters may preferable.  "northern_hemisphere" parameters estimate MAT.  Use "global" MAP estimates. Defaults "global" follows (Peppe et al. 2011): MAT.MLR.M = 0.21, MAT.MLR.FDR = 42.296, MAT.MLR.TC.IP = -2.609, MAT.MLR.constant = -16.004, MAT.MLR.error = 4, MAT.SLR.M = 0.204, MAT.SLR.constant = 4.6, MAT.SLR.error = 4.9, MAP.MLR.LA = 0.298, MAP.MLR.TC.IP = 0.279, MAP.MLR.PR = -2.717, MAP.MLR.constant = 3.033, MAP.MLR.SE = 0.6, MAP.SLR.LA = 0.283, MAP.SLR.constant = 2.92, MAP.SLR.SE = 0.61 subsite_cols vector list columns present specimen_data calculate paleoclimate estimates .  completely optional parameter - allows different groupings specimens tested, comparisons paleoclimate estimates different levels grouping. Adds additional estimates $results.

title: Generate DiLP results — dilp
text: list tables includes pertinent DiLP information: processed_leaf_data: full set cleaned newly calculated leaf physiognomic data necessary DiLP analysis. See dilp_processing() information. processed_morphotype_data: morphospecies-site pair means leaf physiognomic data. processed_site_data: site means leaf physiognomic data. errors: lists specimens may causing common errors DiLP calculations. See dilp_errors() information. outliers: flags outliers variables used DiLP analysis may represent incorrect data.  See dilp_outliers() information. results: climate reconstructions MAT MAP using single multi-linear regressions.

title: Generate DiLP results — dilp
text: Allen, S. E., Lowe, . J., Peppe, D. J., & Meyer, H. W. (2020). Paleoclimate paleoecology latest Eocene Florissant flora central Colorado, USA. Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology, 551, 109678. Peppe, D.J., Royer, D.L., Cariglino, B., Oliver, S.Y., Newman, S., Leight, E., Enikolopov, G., Fernandez-Burgos, M., Herrera, F., Adams, J.M., Correa, E., Currano, E.D., Erickson, J.M., Hinojosa, L.F., Hoganson, J.W., Iglesias, ., Jaramillo, C.., Johnson, K.R., Jordan, G.J., Kraft, N.J.B., Lovelock, E.C., Lusk, C.H., Niinemets, Ü., Peñuelas, J., Rapson, G., Wing, S.L. Wright, .J. (2011), Sensitivity leaf size shape climate: global patterns paleoclimatic applications. New Phytologist, 190: 724-739. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1469-8137.2010.03615.x Lowe. .J., Flynn, .G., Butrim, M.J., Baumgartner, ., Peppe, D.J., Royer, D.L. (2024), Reconstructing terrestrial paleoclimate paleoecology fossil leaves using Digital Leaf Physiognomy leaf mass per area.  JoVE.

what: Test if site leaf physiognomy falls within the physiognomic space of the DiLP calibration dataset — dilp_cca
title: Test if site leaf physiognomy falls within the physiognomic space of the DiLP calibration dataset — dilp_cca
text: dilp_cca plots canonical correspondence analysis (CCA) ordination leaf physiognomic space represented calibration dataset Peppe et al. (2011). fossil sites tested placed along CCA axes.  fossil site falls outside plotted calibration space, paleoclimate reconstructions fossil site treated caution.

title: Test if site leaf physiognomy falls within the physiognomic space of the DiLP calibration dataset — dilp_cca
code: dilp_cca(   dilp_table,   physiognomy_calibration = physiognomyCalibration,   climate_calibration = climateCalibration )

title: Test if site leaf physiognomy falls within the physiognomic space of the DiLP calibration dataset — dilp_cca
text: dilp_table results call dilp() physiognomy_calibration physiognomic calibration dataset. Defaults internal version physiognomy_calibration_data. climate_calibration climate calibration dataset. Defaults internal version climate_calibration_data.

title: Test if site leaf physiognomy falls within the physiognomic space of the DiLP calibration dataset — dilp_cca

what: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
title: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
text: dilp_errors() typically called internally dilp(). However, can used evaluate errors commonly occur data collection processing steps.  dilp_errors() call nearly always follow dilp_processing() call.  Returns data frame.

title: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
code: dilp_errors(specimen_data)

title: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
text: specimen_data Processed specimen level leaf physiognomic data.  structure match structure output dilp_processing()

title: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
text: 7 X data frame.  row shows common error, specimens input dataset tripping .

title: Check for common errors in DiLP measurements — dilp_errors
code: # Check for errors in the provided McAbeeExample dataset. dilp_dataset <- dilp_processing(McAbeeExample) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` dilp_errors <- dilp_errors(dilp_dataset) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` dilp_errors #>                                                   Check Specimen1 #> 1                             Entire tooth count not NA      none #> 2                        Entire tooth count : IP not NA      none #> 3                         Entire perimeter ratio not NA      none #> 4                                   FDR not between 0-1      none #> 5 External perimeter not larger than internal perimeter      none #> 6                Feret is not larger than minimum Feret      none #> 7                    Perimeter ratio not greater than 1      none

title: Identify outlier specimens — dilp_outliers
text: dilp_outliers() typically called internally dilp(). However, can used locate specimens may misreported measured incorrectly.  dilp_outliers() returns data frame listing specimens unusually high low values four key parameters used DiLP analyses.  flagged, may worth taking look raw measurements evaluating specimen used.

title: Identify outlier specimens — dilp_outliers
code: dilp_outliers(specimen_data)

title: Identify outlier specimens — dilp_outliers
text: specimen_data Processed specimen level leaf physiognomic data.  structure match structure output dilp_processing()

title: Identify outlier specimens — dilp_outliers
text: 4 X data frame. row represents one DiLP parameters, specimens outliers parameter.

title: Identify outlier specimens — dilp_outliers
code: # Check for outliers in the provided McAbeeExample dataset. Each # of these outliers has been manually re-examined and was found acceptable. dilp_dataset <- dilp_processing(McAbeeExample) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` dilp_outliers <- dilp_outliers(dilp_dataset) dilp_outliers #>          Variable     Outlier1     Outlier2     Outlier3    Outlier4 #> 1             fdr         <NA>         <NA>         <NA>        <NA> #> 2           tc_ip  BU-712-1117 BU-712-1169A BU-712-1176A        <NA> #> 3       leaf_area BU-712-2173A BU-712-2105A  BU-712-2124        <NA> #> 4 perimeter_ratio   M-2015-1-1 BU-712-1073A  BU-712-1165 M-2015-1-62

what: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
title: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
text: dilp_processing() typically called internally dilp(). However, can used generate view processed DiLP dataset includes raw derived physiognomic values useful DiLP physiognomic analyses.  Returns data frame.

title: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
code: dilp_processing(specimen_data)

title: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
text: specimen_data data frame containing specimen level leaf physiognomic data. good reference put together data: McAbeeExample

title: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
text: data frame containing cleaned processed specimen level leaf physiognomic data.  New variables calculated : Leaf area Feret diameter Feret diameter ratio (FDR) Raw blade perimeter corrected (Raw blade perimeter - length cut perimeter) Internal raw blade perimeter corrected (Internal raw blade perimeter - length cut perimeter) Total tooth count Total tooth count : internal perimeter (TC:IP) Perimeter ratio Petiole metric Aspect ratio Shape factor Compactness Tooth area Tooth area : perimeter (TA:P) Tooth area: internal perimeter (TA:IP) Tooth area : blade area (TA:BA) Average primary tooth area (Avg TA) Tooth count : blade area (TC:BA) Tooth count : perimeter (TC:P)

title: Process raw leaf physiognomic data — dilp_processing
code: dilp_dataset <- dilp_processing(McAbeeExample) #> Adding missing grouping variables: `site`, `morphotype` dilp_dataset #> # A tibble: 192 × 40 #>    site      specimen_number morphotype measurer_comments margin petiole_width #>    <chr>     <chr>           <chr>      <chr>              <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 McAbee H1 BU-712-1006     M1         NA                     0         0.165 #>  2 McAbee H1 BU-712-1022A    M1         NA                     0         0.047 #>  3 McAbee H1 BU-712-1065B    M1         NA                     0        NA     #>  4 McAbee H1 BU-712-1083     M1         NA                     0         0.075 #>  5 McAbee H1 BU-712-1122     M1         NA                     0         0.074 #>  6 McAbee H1 BU-712-1133     M1         NA                     0         0.051 #>  7 McAbee H1 BU-712-1210     M1         NA                     0         0.138 #>  8 McAbee H1 BU-712-1214A    M1         NA                     0         0.142 #>  9 McAbee H1 BU-712-1216     M1         NA                     0         0.05  #> 10 McAbee H1 M-2015-1-104    M1         NA                     0         0.121 #> # ℹ 182 more rows #> # ℹ 34 more variables: petiole_area <dbl>, blade_area <dbl>, #> #   blade_perimeter <lgl>, feret <dbl>, minimum_feret <lgl>, #> #   raw_blade_area <dbl>, raw_blade_perimeter <dbl>, #> #   internal_raw_blade_area <dbl>, internal_raw_blade_perimeter <dbl>, #> #   length_of_cut_perimeter <dbl>, no_primary_teeth <dbl>, #> #   no_of_subsidiary_teeth <dbl>, leaf_area <dbl>, feret_diameter <dbl>, …

what: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
title: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
text: lma() takes either raw processed leaf physiognomic data returns leaf mass per area (LMA) reconstructions species-mean, site-mean, site- variance. lma() calls calc_lma() multiple times different sets parameters.  See calc_lma() control LMA reconstructions.

title: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
code: lma(specimen_data)

title: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
text: specimen_data table must include "Site", "Morphotype", either "Petiole Metric", "Blade Area", "Petiole Area", "Petiole Width".

title: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
text: list tables containing leaf mass per area reconstructions. species_mean_lma contains average LMA morphospecies-site pair. Values calculated using regression Royer et al. (2007). royer_site_mean_lma contains average LMA site. Values calculated using regression Royer et al. (2007) lowe_site_lma contains average LMA site. Values calculated using regression Lowe et al. (2024) lowe_variance contains variance LMA site. Values calculated using regression Lowe et al. (2024)

title: Generate a suite of leaf mass per area results — lma
text: Royer, D. L., L. Sack, P. Wilf, C. H. Lusk, G. J. Jordan, Ulo Niinemets, . J. Wright, et al. 2007. Fossil Leaf Economics Quantified: Calibration, Eocene Case Study, Implications. Paleobiology 33: 574–589 Lowe, . J., D. L. Royer, D. J. Wieczynski, M. J. Butrim, T. Reichgelt, L. Azevedo-Schmidt, D. J. Peppe, et al. 2024. Global patterns community-scale leaf mass per area distributions woody non-monocot angiosperms utility fossil record. review.

Describes leaf linearity compared circle Perimeter.ratio Ratio - Raw blade perimeter:Internal raw blade perimeter TC.P Ratio - Tooth count:Perimeter TC.IP Ratio - Tooth count:Internal perimeter Avg.TA Average area primary tooth TA.BA Ratio - Tooth area:Blade area TA.P Ratio - Tooth area:Perimeter TA.IP Ratio - Tooth area:Internal perimeter TC.BA Ratio - Tooth count:Blade area Margin Percentage untoothed species site

what: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
text: precip_slr() produce estimates mean annual precipitation standard error using leaf area analysis.

title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
code: precip_slr(   data,   regression = "Peppe2018",   slope = NULL,   constant = NULL,   error = NULL )

title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
text: data data frame must include columns "morphotype", "leaf_area", "specimen_number". Must species level data. regression string representing one following pre-loaded regressions: "Peppe2018" - global precipitation estimates "Peppe2011" - Americas, Japan, Oceania "Jacobs2002" - Africa "Wilf1998" - Americas Africa slope Slope, using custom regression constant Constant, using custom regression error Standard error, using custom regression

title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
text: table MAP estimates site

title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
text: Peppe, D. J., Baumgartner, ., Flynn, ., & Blonder, B. (2018). Reconstructing paleoclimate paleoecology using fossil leaves. Methods paleoecology: Reconstructing Cenozoic terrestrial environments ecological communities, 289-317. Peppe, D.J., Royer, D.L., Cariglino, B., Oliver, S.Y., Newman, S., Leight, E., Enikolopov, G., Fernandez-Burgos, M., Herrera, F., Adams, J.M., Correa, E., Currano, E.D., Erickson, J.M., Hinojosa, L.F., Hoganson, J.W., Iglesias, ., Jaramillo, C.., Johnson, K.R., Jordan, G.J., Kraft, N.J.B., Lovelock, E.C., Lusk, C.H., Niinemets, Ü., Peñuelas, J., Rapson, G., Wing, S.L. Wright, .J. (2011), Sensitivity leaf size shape climate: global patterns paleoclimatic applications. New Phytologist, 190: 724-739. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1469-8137.2010.03615.x Jacobs, B. F. (2002). Estimation low-latitude paleoclimates using fossil angiosperm leaves: examples Miocene Tugen Hills, Kenya. Paleobiology, 28, 399–421. Wilf, P. (2008). Fossil angiosperm leaves: paleobotany’s difficult children prove . Paleontological Society Papers, 14, 319–333.

title: Estimate precipitation with simple linear regression — precip_slr
code: precip_slr(McAbeeExample, regression = "Peppe2011") #>        site  n    lower      MAP    upper #> 1 McAbee H1 17 57.88926 126.7697 360.0805 #> 2 McAbee H2 13 62.04646 135.8734 385.9390

what: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
text: temp_slr() produce estimates mean annual temperature standard error using leaf margin analysis.

title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
code: temp_slr(   data,   regression = "Peppe2018",   slope = NULL,   constant = NULL,   error = NULL )

title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
text: data data frame must include columns "morphotype" "margin". Can species site level data. regression string representing one following pre-loaded regressions: "Peppe2018" - global temperature estimates "Peppe2011" - Americas, Japan, Oceania "Peppe2011NH" - Peppe 2011 (Northern Hemisphere ) "Miller2006" - North Central America "WingGreenwood" - East Asia - original leaf margin analysis regression "Wilf1997" - Americas slope Slope, using custom regression constant Constant, using custom regression error Standard error, using custom regression

title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
text: table MAT estimates site

title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
text: Miller, . M., Brandon, M. T., & Hickey, L. J. (2006). Using leaf margin analysis estimate mid-Cretaceous (Albian) paleolatitude Baja BC block. Earth Planetary Science Letters, 245, 95–114. Peppe, D. J., Baumgartner, ., Flynn, ., & Blonder, B. (2018). Reconstructing paleoclimate paleoecology using fossil leaves. Methods paleoecology: Reconstructing Cenozoic terrestrial environments ecological communities, 289-317. Peppe, D.J., Royer, D.L., Cariglino, B., Oliver, S.Y., Newman, S., Leight, E., Enikolopov, G., Fernandez-Burgos, M., Herrera, F., Adams, J.M., Correa, E., Currano, E.D., Erickson, J.M., Hinojosa, L.F., Hoganson, J.W., Iglesias, ., Jaramillo, C.., Johnson, K.R., Jordan, G.J., Kraft, N.J.B., Lovelock, E.C., Lusk, C.H., Niinemets, Ü., Peñuelas, J., Rapson, G., Wing, S.L. Wright, .J. (2011), Sensitivity leaf size shape climate: global patterns paleoclimatic applications. New Phytologist, 190: 724-739. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1469-8137.2010.03615.x Wing, S., & Greenwood, D. R. (1993). Fossils fossil climate: case equable continental interiors Eocene. Philosophical Transactions Royal Society London Series B, 341, 243–252. Wilf, P. (1997). leaves good thermometers? new case leaf margin analysis. Paleobiology, 23, 373–390.

title: Estimate temperature with simple linear regression — temp_slr
code: temp_slr(McAbeeExample, regression = "Peppe2011") #>        site  n    lower      MAT    upper #> 1 McAbee H1 31 6.180645 11.18065 16.18065 #> 2 McAbee H2 30 4.360000  9.36000 14.36000

title: dilp 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-11

title: dilp 1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission dilp() given new argument subsite_cols allow multiple tiers specimen/morphotype organization. dilp() given new options regression parameters params. Choose “global” “northern_hemisphere”.

title: dilp (development version 0.0.0.9001)
text: Functions implemented simple linear regression (temp_slr() precip_slr())

title: dilp (development version 0.0.0.9000)
text: Functions implemented digital leaf physiognomy (dilp()) Functions implemented leaf mass per area reconstruction (lma())
